page.title: 10East Oakley Village Hall
page.content: {East Oakley Village Hall}was built in 1913 by the Manydown Estates as a Workingmen's Club. In 1956, it was given over for general village use. The first hiring was The Good Companions, an old folks group which still meets there today. The hall still provides a valuable service in the village. There are over 35{jumble {sales}each year in aid of various village groups. The{Methodist Youth {Club}meets there every week and there is a{Bingo Night}almost every Monday in the year.{Whist drives}have recently lost popularity and have been phased out. There are occasional "whole day sales" when commodities such as wool and household items are sold. The hall no longer has a music licence because of its close proximity to houses.
